member.summary: Constants which determine how the control reacts to changes in its overall width.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.GanttViewHorizontalResizeMode.AnchorGrid
member.summary: The width of the grid area of the control remains constant unless directly changed programmatically or by dragging the vertical splitter. The width of the chart area changes when the width of the control is changed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.GanttViewHorizontalResizeMode.AnchorChart
member.summary: The width of the chart area of the control remains constant unless directly changed programmatically or by dragging the vertical splitter. The width of the grid area changes when the width of the control is changed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.GanttViewHorizontalResizeMode.Proportional

Notes to Inheritors: When overriding OnTaskDialogDisplaying in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnTaskDialogDisplaying method so that registered delegates receive the event.

remarks.p: The constituent parts of a task, such as the start/end indicators, the main bar, the percent complete indicator, and the deadline indicator, can be dragged separately by the user to change the value of the associated task property. The TaskElementDragging event provides a notificatin during the different phases of this operation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.ActiveField
member.summary: Gets or sets a TaskField value indicating the current active field which corresponds to the column in the grid portion of the GanttView.

remarks.para: The active field allows you to get or set which field is active in the grid portion of the GanttView. ActiveField will return null if there is no active cell in the current ActiveTask row, or if there is no current ActiveTask.
Note: ActiveTask will return TaskField.Custom for any custom columns. To get they key of the active column when custom columns are defined, use .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.ActiveFieldKey

remarks.para: The active field allows you to get or set which field is active in the grid portion of the GanttView. ActiveField will return null if there is no active cell in the current ActiveTask row, or if there is no current ActiveTask.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.AutoDisplayDefaultContextMenu
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether the default context menu is automatically displayed when the user right-clicks within the appropriate area of the control.

remarks.p: By default, a context menu appears when the user right-clicks in the grid area. The AutoDisplayDefaultContextMenu property can be used to prevent this, or to allow it when the user right-clicks in the timeline area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.Appearance
member.summary: Gets/sets the main appearance for the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.AutoDisplayTaskDialog
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether the TaskDialog is automatically displayed when the user double-clicks within the appropriate area of the control.

remarks.p: By default, a dialog appears when the user double-clicks within in the grid area which provides a way to edit the selected task in a modal dialog session. The AutoDisplayTaskDialog property can be used to prevent this, or to allow it when the user double-clicks in the timeline area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.ChartAreaWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the width of the chart area of the control.

remarks.p: The "chart area" refers to the area on the right side of the control in which the timeline and task bars are displayed.
Changing the value of the ChartAreaWidth property also affects the GridAreaWidth property since the client area of the control is divided among these two areas.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.ChartAreaWidthResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the ChartAreaWidth property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.DisplayAreas
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines which setions of the control are displayed (grid, timeline, or both).

member.summary: Contains the GanttViewEventManager instance which controls event firings for the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.GridAreaWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the width of the grid area of the control.

remarks.p: The "grid area" refers to the area on the left side of the control in which the task grid is displayed.
Changing the value of the GridAreaWidth property also affects the ChartAreaWidth property since the client area of the control is divided among these two areas.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.GridAreaWidthResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the GridAreaWidth property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.GridSettings
member.summary: Returns a GridSettings instance which determines grid-specific properties of the task, such as the appearance of the row and the settings for the cells.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.HorizontalResizeMode
member.summary: Returns or sets the manner in which the control reacts to changes in its width.

remarks.p: By default, resizing the control horizontally affects only the chart area; the grid area is "anchored", and the change in width is applied to the chart area. The HorizontalResizeMode property can be set to make the grid area respond to changes in width instead, or to maintain the ratio between the grid and chart areas.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.Project
member.summary: Returns or sets the Project currently being displayed by the control.

remarks.p: By default, the Project property returns the UnassignedProject; subsequently, only tasks which have not been explicitly assigned to a different project are displayed. Setting the Project property essentially "filters" out the tasks which do not belong to the assigned project.
When the Project property is set to a new value, the timeline is automatically scrolled to bring the StartDate of that project into the viewable area of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.VerticalSplitterAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the appearance for the VerticalSplitterUIElement which separates the grid area and the chart area of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.VerticalSplitterEnabled
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the vertical splitter which separates the grid area and chart area is enabled in the user interface.

remarks.p: By default, the user can change the width of the grid area or chart area by dragging the vertical splitter; setting the VerticalSplitterEnabled property to false prevents this, in effect locking the GridAreaWidth and ChartAreaWidth.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttView.VerticalSplitterMinimumResizeWidth

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.ContextMenuInitializingEventArgs.ContextMenu
member.summary: Returns or sets the ContextMenu that will be assigned to the control's ContextMenu property if the event is not canceled.

remarks.p: At the time the ContextMenuInitializing event is fired, the ContextMenu property returns the default context menu. A listener of the event can set this property to override this default context menu, and display a different one.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.ContextMenuInitializingEventArgs.DefaultContextMenu
member.summary: Returns GanttViewContextMenu that is displayed by default if the event is not canceled.

remarks.p: Each time the ContextMenuInitializing is fired, the MenuItems collection is re-populated with the default menu items based on the context and the current state of the control. member.summary: Determines the Maximum and LargeChange properties, as well as the largest valid vertical scroll position and the enabled state of the vertical scrollbar.
member.param: The height of the scroll area; for the grid this is the area in which rows appear, for the chart it is the time slot area.
[out] Upon return, contains the value of the scrollbar's Maximum property.
[out] Upon return, contains the value of the scrollbar's LargeChange property.
[ref] Upon return, contains the largest valid scroll position so as not to leave unused space at the bottom of the grid or chart.
[out] Upon return, contains a generic list which contains the height of each item, in the same order as the TaskManager's VisibleTasks collection.
[ref] Upon return, contains the enabled state of the scrollbar.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.ToolTipSettings.Title
member.summary: Returns or sets the string that is displayed as the title for the tooltip.

remarks.p: By default, the value "Summary" is displayed when the task's IsSummary property returns true. The value "Milestone" is displayed when the task's Milestone property returns true. "Deadline" is displayed as the title when the tootip is displayed for the deadline indicator, and "Progress" is displayed as the title when the tootip is displayed for the progress indicator. For standard tasks, the value "Task" is displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.ToolTipSettings.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets the format that is applied to the dates/times displayed in the tooltip.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified value does not represent a valid format string for a date/time value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.ToolTipSettings.DefaultDateTimeFormat
member.summary: Returns the default value for the DateTimeFormat property

remarks.p: The default format is derived by prepending the three-letter representation of the name of the day of the week to the current culture's ShortDatePattern.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Timeline.AutoAddAdditionalInterval
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether a weekly DateTimeInterval automatically appears above the PrimaryInterval.

remarks.p: When the AutoAddAdditionalInterval property returns true, a weekly interval automatically appears above the primary interval so that the days of each week are grouped. This interval is not added to the AdditionalIntervals, but does appear in the VisibleIntervals collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Timeline.AdditionalIntervals
member.summary: Returns a collection of DateTimeInterval-derived instances which define the date/time intervals that appear above the PrimaryInterval.

remarks.p: For detailed information on the subject of the AdditionalIntervals collection, see the documentation for the AdditionalIntervals property of the UltraTimelineView control.

By default, a DateTimeInterval which spans one week is added to the AdditionalIntervals collection. This instance can be removed from the collection at any time. To restore the collection to its default state, including this default interval, use the Reset method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.GanttViewContextMenu.DefaultItems
member.summary: Returns a collection of GanttViewContextMenuItem instances which represents all items that are displayed by default when the context menu appears.

remarks.p: The collection returned by the DefaultItems collection stands independent of the MenuItems collection; the DefaultItems collection contains all items, regardless of whether they will appear on the context menu. Whether an item appears on the menu and whether it is enabled is determined by the control based on context-sensitive factors and the current state of the control.

The GanttViewContextMenuItem exposes Enabled and Visible properties, which can be set by the developer. These values are initialized for each item prior to displaying the context menu, based on context-sensitive factors and the current state of the control. Caution should be used when enabling or showing an item that is disabled or hidden by the control, since doing so can result in unexpected behavior.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.GanttViewContextMenuAction.InsertTask
member.summary: If the ActiveTask is null, a Task is added to the root Tasks collection. If the ActiveTask is not null, a task is inserted above the active task. The task is added with the default 'AsSoonAsPossible' constraint.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.GanttViewContextMenuAction.AddSubTask
member.summary: A sub-task is added to the ActiveTask's Tasks collection, with a 'StartNoEarlierThan' constraint, using the ActiveTask's StartDateTime as its starting date/time.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.GanttViewContextMenuAction.RemoveTask
member.summary: The currently active Task is removed. Any sub-tasks which belonged to the task are removed as well.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Grid.GanttViewGrid.PerformKeyAction(System.Enum,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a specific key action
member.param: An enumeration value that determines the user action to be performed.

A boolean specifies whether the action should be performed as if the control key is depressed. This mainly affects actions where selection is involved and determines if the existing selection is maintained, as it is when the user holds down the control key and selects a row in a grid.

A boolean specifies whether the action should be performed as if the shift key is depressed. This mainly affects actions where selection is involved and determines if the existing selection is extended, as it is when the user holds down the shift key and selects a range of rows in a grid.
member.returns: true if the action completed successfully, false if the action failed.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument
member.summary: Component for rendering the ganttView information of an to the printer.

remarks.p: The UltraGanttViewPrintDocument component is used to print the contents of an associated in the style of an UltraGanttView control.

Since priting requires output analogous to the UltraGanttView control, the component creates an instance of an UltraGanttView control as required for the print operation. The component also exposes a property. When a GanttView control is created for the print operation, the properties of the corresponding GanttView control are copied to the control created by the print document. In addition, the component exposes an event to allow this control to be initialized. For example, when output is being generated, an UltraGanttView is created by the print document; if the property is set, the properties of that control that do not conflict with the requirements for the print operation are copied over to the newly created control. Subsequently, the event is invoked to allow any further modification of the control.

member.param: True if the component is being deserialized from a stream

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.AutoSizeGrid
member.summary: Gets / sets whether columns and rows will be automatically sized to fit their contents before printing.

remarks.para: Note: columns with set to True will not be autosized horizontally. This is to prevent columns for memo or other extremely large fields from becoming too wide. If you want to autosize a multiline column, you should do so in the event by calling the method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.AutoSizeTimelineColumns
member.summary: Gets / sets whether columns of the timeline portion of the GanttView will be automatically sized before printing.
member.remarks: The 'Optimized' option will use the minimum width of the timeline columns for the primary internal to determine the minimum number of pages on which all of the data can be printed. If there is extra horizontal space left over, the column width will be increased to utilize the maximum amount of horizontal space without creating any extra pages.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.CreationFilter
member.summary: Returns or sets an object implementing the interface. This object is invoked during the print operation to allow for manipulation of the positioning and creation of uielements.

remarks.p: Returns or sets the object used to manipulate the size, creation and positioning of elements. The property of the controls created for the print operation will be initialized to this property’s value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.DrawFilter
member.summary: Returns or sets an object implementing the interface. This object is invoked during the print operation to allow elements to be owner drawn.

remarks.p: Returns or sets the class used to owner draw sections of the print results. The property of the controls created for the print operation will be initialized to this property’s value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.EndDateTime
member.summary: Returns or sets the end date of the print output.

remarks.p: Note If StartDateTime and EndDateTime are the same, the print output will begin one PrimaryInterval before the start of hte first task and end one PrimaryInterval after the end of the last task.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.ExpandAllTasks
member.summary: Gets / sets whether the tasks will be expanded in the print operation.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true, all tasks will print as though they were expanded. Otherwise, the tasks will print honoring the Expanded property (WYSIWYG).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.LegendSettings
member.summary: Returns a LegendSettings instance which determines legend-specific properties, such as the appearance of the legend and the page(s) on which the legend appears.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.PrintXColumnsOnEveryPage
member.summary: Returns or sets the number of columns which will be re-printing on every horizontal page.

remarks.p: When this property is set to a value higher than 0, the first visible grid columns will be reprinted on every subsequent horizontal page. Note that the RowSelectors are considered a column for this purpose.
If the columns which repeat on each page are too wide to fit on a single page with at least one additional column, then a printing error will result and nothing will be printed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.StartDateTime
member.summary: Returns or sets the end date of the print output.

remarks.p: Note If StartDateTime and StartDateTime are the same, the print output will begin one PrimaryInterval before the start of hte first task and end one PrimaryInterval after the end of the last task.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.GanttView
member.summary: Returns or sets the control whose properties are used to initialize a print output.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.TotalNumberOfPages
member.summary: Gets the total number of pages to be printed or null if that value cannot be determined.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.Error
member.summary: Invoked when an error occurs which prevents the print operation from proceeding.

remarks.p: This event will fire when the generation of the print output results in an error. For example, if there are not tasks to print, or if the results in repeating columns that fill the entire width of the page and leave no room for other content.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UltraGanttViewPrintDocument.InitializeGanttView
member.summary: Invoked when an control is created for the print operation.

remarks.p: The control's PrimaryInterval determines the level of detail of the printed output.

The UltraGanttViewPrintDocument creates and instance of the GanttView control in order to render the GanttView information to the printer. When the control is created, it is initialized based on the GanttView property and then the associated initialize event (e.g. ) is invoked to allow any further customizations to the control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Internal.TaskManager
member.summary: Used to provide a commincation layer between the Task object and the UltraGanttView control.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Internal.TaskManager.OnTaskProxyPropertyChanged(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Internal.TaskProxy,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Internal.TaskProxyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary:
Called by the TaskProxy object when a property changes. These notifications are generated by the Task object's SubObjectPropChanged event, so one can be issued when a Task property is changed via the grid, chart, or programmatically. The TaskProxy object can also call this method directly, which we will use in cases where we want to "simulate" a change in a Task property value.
Originally I had this as an actual event off TaskProxy, but this eliminates the need for the TaskManager to register/unregister as a listener, and since it is always going to opt in for notifications, this is easier.

member.summary: None; used for variable initialization.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Internal.TaskManagerPropertyChangedType.ColumnHeaderAreaHeight
member.summary: Notifies listeners that the height of the TimelineSettings's header area has changed. Motivated by the grid's need to synchronize the height of its own column headers with that of the timeline's. The context for this notification is the new height, in pixels, of the timeline's header area.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Internal.TaskManagerPropertyChangedType.RowHeight
member.summary: Notifies listeners that the height of a task has changed. Motivated by the grid's need to synchronize a row's height with that of a Task's RowHeight property when that property is changed programmatically. The context for this notification is the index of the row, NOT THE NEW HEIGHT because the grid would otherwise have no way to know which row's height has changed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Internal.TaskManagerPropertyChangedType.ExpandedStateChanged
member.summary: Notifies listeners that the expanded state of one or more tasks has changed. Context is the highest-level task whose expanded state has changed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.Internal.TaskManagerPropertyChangedType.CalendarInfoAttached
member.summary: Notifies listeners that the control has been attached to a new UltraCalendarInfo instance. The TaskManager is repopulated in this case, since the Tasks collection with which it is associated is no longer associated with the control. The context for this notification is null.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UIElements.UltraGanttViewUIElement
member.summary: UIElement-derived class which represents the UltraGanttView control in the user interface.

remarks.p: The UltraGanttViewUIElement encapsulates the physical manifestation of the UltraGanttView control. All UIElement-derived instances which represent the various different physical elements of the control appear as descendants of the UltraGanttViewUIElement.

The following table lists the names of each of the application styling roles extended by the UltraGanttView control:
Role UIElement Description
GanttViewControlAreaUltraGanttViewUIElementRole which represents the control itself.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGanttView.UIElements.UltraGanttViewUIElement.PerformKeyAction(System.Enum,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a specific key action
member.param: An enumeration value that determines the user action to be performed.

A booean specifies whether the action should be performed as if the control key is depressed. This mainly affects actions where selection is involved and determines if the existing selection is maintained, as it is when the user holds down the control key and selects a row in a grid.

A booean specifies whether the action should be performed as if the shift key is depressed. This mainly affects actions where selection is involved and determines if the existing selection is extended, as it is when the user holds down the shift key and selects a range of rows in a grid.
member.returns: true if the action completed successfully, false if the action failed.
